body:
I've checked your test on my side on two machines from your branch.

Don't know why this could fail. 
I've checked the source code and it supposed to be working because `halted` variable is checked before running `@compiled_options` 

``` ruby
          <<-RUBY_EVAL
            if !halted && #{@compiled_options}
              # This double assignment is to prevent warnings in 1.9.3 as
              # the `result` variable is not always used except if the
              # terminator code refers to it.
              result = result = #{@filter}
              halted = (#{chain.config[:terminator]})
              if halted
                halted_callback_hook(#{@raw_filter.inspect.inspect})
              end
            end
            #{code}
          RUBY_EVAL

```
